aframe-text-component.author: Kevin Ngo <me@ngokevin.com>
aframe-text-component.name: text
aframe-text-component.readmeExcerpt:
A text geometry component for A-Frame VR. The text geometry component (shape) can be paired with the material component (appearance).

Install and use by directly including the browser files:

Install via NPM:

Then register and use.

The text component uses typeface.js, fonts defined in JS files for three.js. typeface fonts can be generated from regular fonts using this typeface font generator. You can also find some sample generated fonts, currently in the examples/fonts directory in the three.js repository.

aframe-stereo-component.author: Óscar Marín Miró <oscar@outliers.es> @oscarmarinmiro
aframe-stereo-component.name: stereo
aframe-stereo-component.readmeExcerpt:
A stereo component for A-Frame VR.

This component builds on the ['layer' concept of THREE.js] (https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/issues/6437) and is really two components in one:

If a video is used in a sphere with the 'stereo' component active, the component will also enable playback in mobile devices, by attaching a 'click' event on the rendering canvas. Thus, in mobile devices you must click on the screen (via cardboard v2.0 button or with your finger) for the video to start playing.

You can see demos for both examples below [here] (http://oscarmarinmiro.github.io/aframe-stereo-component)

Install and use by directly including the browser files:

aframe-bmfont-text-component.author: Ben Pyrik <ben@wsundine.com>
aframe-bmfont-text-component.name: bmfont-text
aframe-bmfont-text-component.readmeExcerpt:
This component is useful for rendering bitmap and signed distance field font text in A-Frame. Basically, it wraps Matt DesLauriers' three-bmfont-text and load-bmfont.

More details on these properties here.

Explanation of 'mode' property here.

Write some text:

aframe-mountain-component.author: Kevin Ngo <me@ngokevin.com>
aframe-mountain-component.description: Mountain terrain in A-Frame using randomly-generated height maps
aframe-mountain-component.name: mountain
aframe-mountain-component.readmeExcerpt:
Mountain component and primitive for A-Frame.

Uses Perlin noise to create a height map, create a shaded texture from that height map using a <canvas>, and using the height map to create vertices on a BufferGeometry.

Install and use by directly including the browser files:

Install via NPM:

Then register and use.

aframe-animation-component.author: Kevin Ngo <me@ngokevin.com>
aframe-animation-component.name: animation
aframe-animation-component.readmeExcerpt:
Currently depends on 0.3.0 or the master branch of A-Frame.

An animation component for A-Frame using anime.js.

A-Frame has an <a-animation> API out of the box. Why build a component version?

Base name is animation. Although we can attach multiple animations to one entity by name-spacing the component with double underscores (__):

Choose one type from the Type column, and combine it with one function from the Function column. For example: easeInOutElastic. The only exception is linear which stands on its own.
